snippet: An earlier 2006 plan aimed at removing 8,000 Marines from the island hinged on relocating an important Marine air base.
abstract: Japan and the United States say that they are renegotiating a 2006 agreement in order to expedite the removal of 8,000 Marines from Okinawa; under the current terms, their departure has been stalled until progress is made on relocating an important Marine air station on the island, a chronic underlying irritant in relations between the two countries.
lead_paragraph: An earlier 2006 plan aimed at removing 8,000 Marines from the island hinged on relocating an important Marine air base.

headline.seo: U.S. and Japan in Talks to Expedite Marine Exit From Okinawa
headline.main: U.S. and Japan Are in Talks to Expedite Exit of 8,000 Marines on Okinawa
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Japan Are in Talks to Expedite Exit of 8,000 Marines on Okinawa

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
